verses.verse: But now they that are younger <WH6810> <WH3117> than I have me in derision <WH7832> <WH8804>, whose fathers <WH1> I would have disdained <WH3988> <WH8804> to have set <WH7896> <WH8800> with the dogs <WH3611> of my flock <WH6629>.
Yea, whereto <WH4100> might the strength <WH3581> of their hands <WH3027> profit me, in whom old age <WH3624> was perished <WH6> <WH8804> ?
For want <WH2639> and famine <WH3720> they were solitary <WH1565>; fleeing <WH6207> <WH8802> into the wilderness <WH6723> in former time <WH570> desolate <WH7722> and waste <WH4875>.
Who cut up <WH6998> <WH8801> mallows <WH4408> by the bushes <WH7880>, and juniper <WH7574> roots <WH8328> for their meat <WH3899>.
They were driven forth <WH1644> <WH8792> from among <WH1460> men, (they cried <WH7321> <WH8686> after them as after a thief <WH1590>;)
To dwell <WH7931> <WH8800> in the clifts <WH6178> of the valleys <WH5158>, in caves <WH2356> of the earth <WH6083>, and in the rocks <WH3710>.
Among the bushes <WH7880> they brayed <WH5101> <WH8799>; under the nettles <WH2738> they were gathered together <WH5596> <WH8792>.
They were children <WH1121> of fools <WH5036>, yea, children <WH1121> of base men <WH8034>: they were viler <WH5217> <WH8738> than the earth <WH776>.
And now am I their song <WH5058>, yea, I am their byword <WH4405>.
They abhor <WH8581> <WH8765> me, they flee far <WH7368> <WH8804> from me, and spare <WH2820> <WH8804> not to spit <WH7536> in my face <WH6440>.
Because he hath loosed <WH6605> <WH8765> my cord <WH3499>, and afflicted <WH6031> <WH8762> me, they have also let loose <WH7971> <WH8765> the bridle <WH7448> before <WH6440> me.

Upon my right <WH3225> hand rise <WH6965> <WH8799> the youth <WH6526>; they push away <WH7971> <WH8765> my feet <WH7272>, and they raise up <WH5549> <WH8799> against me the ways <WH734> of their destruction <WH343>.
They mar <WH5420> <WH8804> my path <WH5410>, they set forward <WH3276> <WH8686> my calamity <WH1942> <WH8675> <WH1962>, they have no helper <WH5826> <WH8802>.
They came <WH857> <WH8799> upon me as a wide <WH7342> breaking <WH6556> in of waters: in <WH8478> the desolation <WH7722> they rolled <WH1556> <WH8701> themselves upon me.
Terrors <WH1091> are turned <WH2015> <WH8717> upon me: they pursue <WH7291> <WH8799> my soul <WH5082> as the wind <WH7307>: and my welfare <WH3444> passeht away <WH5674> <WH8804> as a cloud <WH5645>.
And now my soul <WH5315> is poured out <WH8210> <WH8691> upon me; the days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> have taken hold <WH270> <WH8799> upon me.
My bones <WH6106> are pierced <WH5365> <WH8765> in me in the night season <WH3915>: and my sinews <WH6207> <WH8802> take no rest <WH7901> <WH8799>.
By the great <WH7230> force <WH3581> of my disease is my garment <WH3830> changed <WH2664> <WH8691>: it bindeth me about <WH247> <WH8799> as the collar <WH6310> of my coat <WH3801>.
He hath cast <WH3384> <WH8689> me into the mire <WH2563>, and I am become like <WH4911> <WH8691> dust <WH6083> and ashes <WH665>.
I cry <WH7768> <WH8762> unto thee, and thou dost not hear <WH6030> <WH8799> me: I stand up <WH5975> <WH8804>, and thou regardest <WH995> <WH8709> me not.
Thou art become <WH2015> <WH8735> cruel <WH393> to me: with thy strong <WH6108> hand <WH3027> thou opposest <WH7852> <WH8799> thyself against me.
Thou liftest me up <WH5375> <WH8799> to the wind <WH7307>; thou causest me to ride <WH7392> <WH8686> upon it, and dissolvest <WH4127> <WH8787> my substance <WH8454> <WH8675> <WH7738> <WH8762>.
For I know <WH3045> <WH8804> that thou wilt bring <WH7725> <WH8686> me to death <WH4194>, and to the house <WH1004> appointed <WH4150> for all living <WH2416>.
Howbeit he will not stretch out <WH7971> <WH8799> his hand <WH3027> to the grave <WH1164>, though they cry <WH7769> in his destruction <WH6365>.
Did not I weep <WH1058> <WH8804> for him that was in trouble <WH7186> <WH3117>? was not my soul <WH5315> grieved <WH5701> <WH8804> for the poor <WH34> ?

When I looked <WH6960> <WH8765> for good <WH2896>, then evil <WH7451> came <WH935> <WH8799> unto me: and when I waited <WH3176> <WH8762> for light <WH216>, there came <WH935> <WH8799> darkness <WH652>.
My bowels <WH4578> boiled <WH7570> <WH8795>, and rested <WH1826> <WH8804> not: the days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> prevented <WH6923> <WH8765> me.
I went <WH1980> <WH8765> mourning <WH6937> <WH8802> without the sun <WH2535>: I stood up <WH6965> <WH8804>, and I cried <WH7768> <WH8762> in the congregation <WH6951>.
I am a brother <WH251> to dragons <WH8577>, and a companion <WH7453> to owls <WH1323> <WH3284>.
My skin <WH5785> is black <WH7835> <WH8804> upon me, and my bones <WH6106> are burned <WH2787> <WH8804> with heat <WH2721>.
My harp <WH3658> also is turned to mourning <WH60>, and my organ <WH5748> into the voice <WH6963> of them that weep <WH1058> <WH8802>.
